ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I gained a great foundation of Tibetan Buddhism; the types of sacred and secular sound in Buddhist music; and the interesting forms of Hip Hop that spread Buddhist themes.
Buddhist principles, the role of music in monastic and secular settings, and critical examination of the intersection between Buddhist philosophy and contemporary hip-hop music all around the world!
Besides a very comprehensive overview of the history of Buddhism, we also explored contemporary Buddhist music.

Through this course, I learned how to think about music and religion creatively and apply these topic to my own life. I also learned how to think critically about Buddhism and express what I have learned in both writing and creative outlets. I have gained a better understand of my own life and goals, and have a different perspective on stress, happiness, and permanence.
Knowledge about the Buddhist religion and music associated with it
I really enjoyed taking a religious studies course with the twist of a musical element.
This course taught be about Buddhism as well as hip hop and music. I loved learning about various Buddhist concepts and discussing application of them in our lives.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The readings throughout the course were all interesting and discussion in class helped solidify any topics that might've been confusing. Dr. Fitzgerald is also an awesome professor and provides insightful feedback on assignments. Also, since assignments are spread all throughout the semester, there was never any point in the semester where you feel overwhelmed, and that definitely was a plus.

Strength - very engaging discussions and fascinating readings.
Weakness - none

Strengths: Professor Fitzgerald is amazing. She is extremely engaging and challenges us to interact with difficult material but breaks it down for us in class. 
Weaknesses: none
Very engaging content, loved the videos (documentary, YouTube, etc) It would be great if there was less reading. Would have preferred more discussion based classroom instead of lecture based.
I enjoyed the open dialogue and small class size for discussion, and the way the canvas page and course grading was spaced out and straightforward
Strengths were definitely the class discussions, presentations, and projects. The course was designed for engagement and creative thinking! I don't think it had any weaknesses.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! I found the Buddhist doctrine incredibly interesting and valuable for all Yale students to consider.

Yes, I would recommend this course to another student.  The content we covered and discussions we had in class really put many things into perspective, and I always left the class feeling more relaxed. I also learned a lot about Tibetan Buddhism and various Tibetan artists, and I'm leaving the class with a better cultural understanding of Tibet and new songs I enjoy!

Most definitely! It's a great course to get introduced to Buddhist principles and ideals (of which I was totally unfamiliar with before the semester). Dr. Fitzgerald is a great professor that emphasizes class discussion, and I feel like I got a lot out of the course and am now much more interested in diving deeper into Buddhist topics.
This course was a lot of fun. I learned a lot about Buddhism and the assignments are well-structured in a way that I felt I could bring in my own interests
Yes - this was such an engaging course and helped me contemplate my own beliefs as well as think about international conflicts.

Yes!! This is my favorite class I have taken at Yale so far. Professor Fitzgerald is extremely kind and knowledgeable. I have spoken to all of my friends about this course and how it has really changed my outlook on happiness.
I would recommend.
Yes
Yes! It helped me think in a new way. I always left the class feeling happier and more inspired.
